titles.title: Citizen Soldier Relief Act of 2005
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude from gross income military pay received by a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces of the United States who is called to active duty.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/28/2005--Introduced. Citizen Soldier Relief Act of 2005 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income military pay received by a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces who is called or ordered to active duty for a period of more than 180 days or for an indefinite period.
